name: Windjammer Landing Villa Beach Resort

reviews.title: The Honeymoon I've always dreamed of!
reviews.text: I had always envisioned what my honeymoon would be like and our stay at the Windjammer Landing made it come to life. It was everything my husband and I were hoping for and then some. I knew nothing about St. Lucia. My parents had given us a timeshare book to look through and allowed us to select a honeymoon as our gift from them. We picked a few places and then drew one out of a hat. And St. Lucia it was. The only reason St. Lucia was an option was because of this website. I figured that there must be something great about this place since so many people gave it 5 stars. I was confused with some of the negative comments but went ahead and took the chance. We went the first week in November. We flew into the southern airprot (HEW). The drive was long but really gave you a feel for the island which started the trip off right. The taxi driver even asked if we wanted to stop and get our photo taken at a neat overcliff. We did and it turned out great. Our hotel room was really unique. Very clean. Large yet cozy. Open but can be closed. Perfect temperature. Cute kitchen with a bottle of champaign and fruit tray waiting for us. Robes on our bed. And the open terrace was breathtaking. The view stretched for miles and we could even see other islands and the pirate ship sailing every morning and evening. That is where we got some of our best pictures. We really enjoyed the one bedroom villa without a plunge pool because then you have the option of opening up your room or completely closing it if you are worried about bugs.

We did not have a bug problem at all except for a cute baby lizard that made its way in. My husband opened the doors one day and birds flew right in. We let them enjoy themselves for a moment and then sent them on their way. I was really afraid that the brochure only looked great and the hotel would not. However it was picture perfect just as it looks online and in the brochure. The beach was perfect for us. We never had a problem getting lounge chairs even after sleeping in and could always find a flag to put up when we were hungry or thirsty. I have been craving the pina coladas since we left. The flags made us feel like royalty being waited on hand and foot. The servers were all wonderful and really gave the resort some personality. The staff had activities scheduled each day like Bingo, Crab races, swim races, water aerobics, etc. They were fun to play and we won tee shirts, champaigne, and rum! We met some wonderful friends there and plan on keeping in touch. We are all going back the same time next year. We did the all inclusive deal and had no regrets.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel, Awesome Island

reviews.text: We went snorkeling and had a great time. The sunset cruise was also one of our highlights. We did the timeshare presentation and it was very low key. No pressure at all. We have been through several and finally decided to purchase the timeshare at this resort. We can't wait to go back again this November. I am a very picky eater and hate to try new things. I like my french fries, pizza, hamburgers, steak, and bacon and eggs, and desserts and I was very happy with the selection and taste. They had a wide variety of island foods but also your everyday foods and they tasted just as I had hoped. Papa Don's was our favorite restaurant. The day we left we got a special treat and got our photo with Kenny Rogers. He was staying at the resort and was very casual with himself and everyone around. We took the helicopter back to the airport which was worth the money and saved us a lot of time. This was the best vacation that either of us have gone on. We have been to many others but we will definately be back to Windjammer Landing. Even though we planned on doing many things we never left the resort (except for dinner once) because we felt everything we needed was right there. I liked that we could use the U.S. dollar and everyone spoke English. One aspect of the island that I remember most is the people that lived and worked there and how friendly and helpful they were. They really appreciate the tourist there. I feel that this island is the Carribean's best kept secret. I highly recommend the Windjammer Landing for your next vacation.

reviews.title: Windjammer - Excellent time
reviews.text: St. Lucia is a beautiful island with lush rainforest, beaches, mountains, and friendly people. It is a rainforest so it does rain but was mostly sunny the entire time I was there.
We stayed at the Windjammer Landing over Christmas and New Years. This was our third stay at the Windjammer, and once again, it was paradise.
reviews.title: We love the Windjammer!!!!

reviews.text: We're a very large family (about 30 people, and an age range of about 8 months to 71), and as always, the Windjammer caters to all of our needs.
reviews.title: Read this - stay elsewhere!
Back again, better than last year
reviews.text: It was very fun to be around a celebrity who was staying at the resort while we were there, and there was always plenty to do.

reviews.title: Heaven on Earth
reviews.text: All of the watersports were tons of fun, with tubing, waterskiing, banana boats rides, etc. I highly recommend one of the open air jeep day trips (there are many to choose from, ask the the Travel desk), which can take you up and down the island.

reviews.title: Not a mosquito in sight
reviews.text: The food has really improved since our last stay, with Dragonfly being my favorite of the 4 restaurants. The spa is very relaxing, as well.

reviews.title: Beautiful Island,Lazy rude staff!
reviews.text: Though the island of St. Lucia was breath taking and full of exploration, our stay at the windjammer was the worst part of the vacation. The service was terribly slow and the attitude of the personel was horrible. We waited on average almost an hour for our meals. When my 9 year old asked politely for another cookie, the waitress said, " you mean I have to walk all the way over there?" The rooms were nice, the food tasted great, but I never seen such lazy personel! My husband never wants to go back to the island because of the rudeness of the people at the resort.

reviews.title: A Resort of Contrasts: good and bad
reviews.text: Booked ocean view rooms expecting these to be in a hotel format. They are not! The room my daughters (28 and 24) were given was terrible. The bathroom was literally an outdoor add on. The toilet was by an open window onto the street although it did have bars! We complained and were upgraded to a two bedroomed villa with pool. The issue was superbly handled by Donna a managers assistant. Our second week was ruined by a group of 150 or more Americans in a wedding party. Typical "herd" behaviour loud, rude, brash and pushy. They dominated the beach, and the bar. They sunbathed on an inflatable trampoline meant for children. Families with children were driven from the bar at night as pushing and shoving got worse in proportion to the amount of alcohol consumed. Resort hotels should think very carefuly about booking big parties in family resorts: they just do not mix. The resort is in need of a face lift,we saw a huge diference between the timeshare and the hotel villas. Bathrooms are dreadful. food is excellent and the staff generally superb with one or two exceptions, mainly the younger femail staff who can be inflexible and sullen at times. Villa shuttle service is very good as is the concierge service with one exception who was completely wooden and robotic. Mosquitos are a nightmare but nets are provided over the beds. We went all inclusive and had very poor value for money having been driven from the public areas by the "herd". we even hired a car for 4 days to escape.
Not a bad resort but if you want a chill out holiday ensure that no large parties are booked in. Would we go back? probably not.
reviews.title: Glad We Chose the Windjammer
Loved the Windjammer
reviews.text: We stayed at the Windjammer in November 2004 and had a fantastic time. The resort is gorgeous, and perhaps one of the best things about it is that it's not "overmaintained." It is landscaped, but still lush and natural, and you don't look at a rock and wonder if a speaker is hidden in there somewhere. It just seemed very real.

reviews.title: The Windjammer was HORRIBLE! BOOK ELSEWHERE!
reviews.text: I honestly don't know what people are talking about when I read these negative reviews. The beach is very pretty, has palm trees decorated with white lights which go on at night, and is has a good swimming area. The two pools aren't huge but are nice, and everything is well-situated so that it's not too far of a walk anywhere you need to go. It also has an internet cafe, and a nice variety of restaurants.

Just returned from 4 night stay. Not long enough. It was the most beautiful island we have ever seen. Beat cruising the Caribbean by a mile. Food great. Views from balcony exquisite. Can't wait to go back for a longer stay. Just the most relaxing place on earth. We used the American Airlines vacation package plus all inclusive meal plan. Can't beat sitting on the beach, putting up a flag, and beiing served tropical drinks and shrimp kebobs for lunch!!!
reviews.title: Paradise found
Average Resort / Average Location
reviews.text: To start off on a positive note the majority of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the resort itself is reasonably maintained, not as well as I would expect for the price, but OK. The restaurants (especially the Dragonfly) were pretty good and not too expensive.

aka: Windjammer Landing Villa Beach Hotel Castries
description: Windjammer Landing Villa Beach Resort & Spa in Saint Lucia, offers an unforgettable Caribbean vacation for families, honeymooners and couples. This exotic 60-acre full service resort is a panorama of picturesque, spacious and secluded hillside villas. With breathtaking views of the cobalt waters of the Caribbean Sea, this Mediterranean village resort is alive with the sights and sounds of beautiful Saint Lucia. Absorb the stunning beauty of nature at the Windjammer Landing. From dining on tropical fruits at sunrise to enjoying a refreshing cruise at sunset and only your choice of what to do in between. Richly appointed with the warmth of wood and an exotic blend of tropical furnishings, your spacious villa sets the mood for complete relaxation and truly your greatest escape.
